trans-unit.source: Provides methods used to render an option button control (also known as a radio button) with or without visual styles.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButtonRenderer> class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render an option button control.
Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control.
To draw an option button, use one of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButtonRenderer.DrawRadioButton%2A> methods.
These methods provide a variety of options, such as drawing text or an image with the option button.

If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButtonRenderer.DrawRadioButton%2A> will draw the option button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButtonRenderer.DrawRadioButton%2A> will draw the option button with the classic Windows style.
This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should automatically match the current visual style setting of the operating system.

This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Button.RadioButton?displayProperty=fullName> class.
For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/rendering-controls-with-visual-styles.md).
Draws the background of a control's parent in the specified area.

If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the option button (also known as a radio button) with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the option button with the classic Windows style.
The used to draw the background of the parent of childControl.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the parent control's background.
This rectangle should be inside the child controlâ€™s bounds.
The control whose parent's background will be drawn.
Draws an option button control (also known as a radio button) in the specified state and location.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the option button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the option button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the option button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the option button glyph at.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.RadioButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the option button.
Draws an option button control (also known as a radio button) in the specified state and location, with the specified text, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the option button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the option button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the option button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the option button glyph at.
The to draw radioButtonText in.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the option button.
The to apply to radioButtonText.
`true` to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, `false`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.RadioButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the option button.
Draws an option button control (also known as a radio button) in the specified state and location, with the specified text and text formatting, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the option button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the option button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the option button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the option button glyph at.
The to draw radioButtonText in.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the option button.
The to apply to radioButtonText.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
`true` to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, `false`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.RadioButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the option button.
Draws an option button control (also known as a radio button) in the specified state and location, with the specified text and image, and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the option button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the option button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the option button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the option button glyph at.
The to draw radioButtonText in.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the option button.
The to apply to radioButtonText.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw with the option button.
The to draw image in.
`true` to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, `false`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.RadioButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the option button.
Draws an option button control (also known as a radio button) in the specified state and location; with the specified text, text formatting, and image; and with an optional focus rectangle.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the option button with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the option button with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the option button.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to draw the option button glyph at.
The to draw radioButtonText in.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the option button.
The to apply to radioButtonText.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to draw with the option button.
The to draw image in.
`true` to draw a focus rectangle; otherwise, `false`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.RadioButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the option button.
Returns the size, in pixels, of the option button (also known as a radio button) glyph.
This value is determined by the current visual style of the operating system.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the option button.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.RadioButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the option button.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the size, in pixels, of the option button glyph.
Indicates whether the background of the option button (also known as a radio button) has semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.RadioButtonState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the option button.
`true` if the background of the option button has semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the renderer uses the application state to determine rendering style.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButtonRenderer.RenderMatchingApplicationState%2A> property is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButtonRenderer> uses the setting from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.RenderWithVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine the rendering style.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButtonRenderer.RenderMatchingApplicationState%2A> is `false`, the renderer will always render using visual styles.
`true` if the application state is used to determine rendering style; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
